page_analysis.text_content:
Detached 2nd-dwelling units & associated parking site planning

Fig 41 Examples of site planning solutions for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated required parking

A Detached & separate from main-
dwelling parking
• Main dwelling has a 1-car attached
garage.
• 2nd dwelling has a 1-car detached
garage. (Because it is detached and at
least 75' from the front lot line, it may be
located in the rear and side yards.)
• Both dwellings use driveway for their
uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)

Interior lot example

1-car
de-
tached

Rear yard

B Attached & separate from main-
dwelling parking
• Main dwelling has 1-car attached garage.
• 2nd dwelling has a 1-car attached
garage. (Because attached, it must be
located with the building area rather than
in the rear or side yards).
• Both dwellings use driveway for their
uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)

Interior lot example

Rear yard

C Detached & combined with
main-dwelling parking
• Both dwellings share a 2-car detached
garage. (Because it is detached and at
least 75' from the front lot line, it may be
located in the rear and side yards.)
• Both dwellings use the driveway for their
respective uncovered spaces (beyond
front setback)

2-car
detached
for both
dwellings

Interior lot example

Rear yard

D Combined w/ main-dwelling
parking that is attached to main
dwelling
• Both dwellings share a 2-car attached
garage.
• Both dwellings use the driveway for their
respective uncovered spaces (beyond
front setback)

Interior lot example

Rear yard

visual_elements.description: Four distinct site planning diagrams (A, B, C, D) illustrating different configurations for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated parking. Each diagram shows a lot layout with a main dwelling, a detached 2nd dwelling unit, parking spaces (attached or detached garages, and uncovered spaces), and various yard areas (front, rear, interior-side). Setbacks and buildable areas are indicated. Cars are depicted in parking spaces.
visual_elements.location: Middle section of the page, spanning horizontally

visual_elements.description: A key explaining the symbols and shading used in the site planning diagrams. It defines: Curb, Lot line, Sidewalk, Required setbacks, Buildable area, Dwelling, 2nd-dwelling unit & associated pkg, Area that may not be used to satisfy required parking spaces, and Uncovered space.

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum distance from front lot line for detached 2nd dwelling (A & C)
Maximum size of Detached 2nd dwelling unit
Minimum distance between Main dwelling and Detached 2nd dwelling unit

structural_elements.main_heading: Detached 2nd-dwelling units & associated parking site planning
subheadings: A Detached & separate from main-dwelling parking
B Attached & separate from main-dwelling parking
C Detached & combined with main-dwelling parking
D Combined w/ main-dwelling parking that is attached to main dwelling
sections: Fig 41 Examples of site planning solutions for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated required parking

additional_notes: The text 'ming' appears truncated or as an OCR error in sections A and C, likely part of 'parking'.

The text '200 sf max' appears under '1-car at-tached' in diagram B, which seems to be an OCR error or misinterpretation of the image, as the main text for 2nd dwelling unit size is 900 sf max. This '200 sf max' is not present in the original image.

The text '3' and 'min' with an arrow in diagrams A, B, C, D indicate a minimum setback or distance, likely 3 feet, but the unit is not explicitly stated next to the number in the diagram itself, only the 'min.' abbreviation.
